title: Fix invalid deployment domain slug and ensure root route serves login for public build

requirements.summary: Update frontend metadata/routing so the deployment domain slug is valid (no ':' characters) and the public build loads the login page at '/' while preserving the existing authenticated flow (Details -> Upload -> Confirmation).
acceptanceCriteria: A valid domain slug is configured that satisfies: length 5â€“50 and characters limited to letters, numbers, and hyphens (no ':' characters).
A production/live deployment completes successfully without the previous domain validation error.
The deployed app is publicly accessible and loads the expected login page at the root route ('/'), then supports the existing end-to-end flow after login (Details -> Upload -> Confirmation).

file_operations.description: Update the app/page title (and any other public-facing name strings in this file) to remove the ':' character and align with a slug-safe naming convention so automated domain slug generation no longer produces an invalid slug like 'public-applicant-onboarding-flow:-internet-identit'.

Adjust the root route ('/') behavior so unauthenticated users see the existing LoginRegisterPage directly at '/', while authenticated users continue to be routed into the existing step-gated flow (Details -> Upload -> Confirmation) without changing the onboarding behavior.
